metadata.name: Windows Terminal Profile Settings Modification By Uncommon Process
metadata.comment: Detects the creation or modification of the Windows Terminal Profile settings file "settings.json" by an uncommon process.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 3 AND (endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\\\cmd.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\\\cscript.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\\\mshta.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\\\pwsh.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\\\wscript.exe'))) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\\\appdata\\\\local\\\\packages\\\\microsoft.windowsterminal_8wekyb3d8bbwe\\\\localstate\\\\settings.json')))

output.summary: Detects the creation or modification of the Windows Terminal Profile settings file "settings.json" by an uncommon process.

metadata.objective: False positive: Some false positives may occur with admin scripts that set WT settings. References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/74438b0237d141ee9c99747976447dc884cb1a39/atomics/T1547.015/T1547.015.md#atomic-test-1---persistence-by-modifying-windows-terminal-profile, https://twitter.com/nas_bench/status/1550836225652686848
